intro: Pilosella woronowiana, commonly known as the alpine mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant is typically found in alpine and subalpine habitats, where it thrives in rocky and well-drained soils. Its leaves are hairy and spoon-shaped, giving it a distinctive appearance, while its flowers are small and yellowish-white. Pilosella woronowiana is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to withstand harsh environmental conditions.
